entry.title: Supporting Faculty who Educate the Educators
entry.summary: It was the fall of 1958 when Meredith Bristow ’62 sat down next to Wally Stevens ’62 in Professor Mary Bilheimer’s biology class. Read more>>
entry.content:

entry.title: Leading by Example
entry.summary: Scott ’75 and Patti-Jeanne (Ryan) Biederman ’76 are well-known and respected both on and off campus for their charitable giving and commitment to community and to Plymouth State. Read more>>
entry.content:

entry.title: A Resounding Gift
entry.summary: In 1962, Michael Trimpi ’92 lived and worked in one of the most remote places on the planet—Eights Station in Antarctica. As a radioscience researcher for Stanford University, his groundbreaking research in upper-atmospheric noise set the course for the rest of his career. Read more>>
entry.content:
In 1962, Michael Trimpi ’92 lived and worked in one of the most remote places on the planet—Eights Station in Antarctica. As a radioscience researcher for Stanford University, his groundbreaking research in upper-atmospheric noise set the course for the rest of his career.

Read more>>

entry.title: A Lasting Gift of Wellness and Recreation
entry.summary: Active living is synonymous with Dick and Betty Hanaway’s lifestyle. The Hanaways, who make a point of thoughtfully living and giving, continued their long-time commitment to PSU. Read more>>
entry.content:
Active living is synonymous with Dick and Betty Hanaway’s lifestyle. The Hanaways, who make a point of thoughtfully living and giving, continued their long-time commitment to PSU.

Read more>>

entry.title: A Gift Correlated with Excellence in Teaching
entry.summary: “Throughout my career, I’ve wanted to do something for faculty,” says Ed Wixson, Plymouth State University emeritus professor of mathematics. Read more>>
entry.content:

entry.title: Alumni News – July 2012
entry.summary: William Lander ’01CAGS has been appointed the superindendent for SAU 72. Read more>> Derek Swenson ’95 is the new director of curriculum and grants at Bridgewater-Raynham Central Office. Read more>> Ryan Dobens ’08 has been selected by The American Institute of Certified Public Accountants to participate in their national Leadership Academy this fall. Marty Brown ’77 is [...]
entry.content:
• William Lander ’01CAGS has been appointed the superindendent for SAU 72. Read more>>
  • Derek Swenson ’95 is the new director of curriculum and grants at Bridgewater-Raynham Central Office. Read more>>
  • Ryan Dobens ’08 has been selected by The American Institute of Certified Public Accountants to participate in their national Leadership Academy this fall.
  • Marty Brown ’77 is retiring from his job as the athletic director and boys basketball coach at Kearsarge High School. Read more>>
  • Lindsey Boutilier ’95 comes home to his dream job, athletic director at Manchester High School. Read more>>
  • Nancy (Brison) Fraher ’77 is running for state senate for district 17 in New Hampshire. Read more>>
  • Jeremy Roberge ’99 is the new CFO at Huggins Hospital in Wolfeboro, NH. Read more>>
Read more about Alumni in the News>>

entry.title: Alumni News – June 2012
entry.summary: Artwork by Amy Brnger ’09G to be shown at Nahcotta in Portsmouth, NH, through July 1, 2012. Read more>> Benjamin Curran ’11G elected to the national Preservation Trades Network Executive Board of Directors. Read more>> Nancy (Brison) Fraher ’77 retires from Candia Elementary School and enters the running for tje Senate District 17 seat in New Hampshire. Read more>> Michael Moffett ’78, ’89G [...]
entry.content:
• Artwork by Amy Brnger ’09G to be shown at Nahcotta in Portsmouth, NH, through July 1, 2012. Read more>>

    Nazli Ighani

  • Benjamin Curran ’11G elected to the national Preservation Trades Network Executive Board of Directors. Read more>>
  • Nancy (Brison) Fraher ’77 retires from Candia Elementary School and enters the running for tje Senate District 17 seat in New Hampshire. Read more>>
  • Michael Moffett ’78, ’89G co-authors Fahim Speaks: A Warrior-Actor’s Odyssey from Afghanistan to Hollywood and Back with Fahim Fazli. Read more>>
  • Nazli Ighani ’12G finds the courage to live her dreams and earns graduate degree despite obstacles. Read more>>
  • Linda (Hersom) Nylund ’74 joins the Homemakers Health Services as community outreach coordinator. Read more>>
  • Rob Scott ’07 appointed assistant principal at Groveton Middle-High School. Read more>>

entry.title: Alumni in the News – May 2012
entry.summary: Richard Wylie ’63, celebrates 25 years as president of Endicott College. Read more>> Shandra McLane ’09G, named a 2012 Remarkable Woman by New Hampshire Magazine. Read more>> Eugene Savage ’58, champion of the state universities passed away on May 14, 2012. Read more>> Karen House ’11G, is the interim vice president of finance and planning at Keene State [...]
entry.content:
• Richard Wylie ’63, celebrates 25 years as president of Endicott College. Read more>>
  • Shandra McLane ’09G, named a 2012 Remarkable Woman by New Hampshire Magazine. Read more>>
  • Eugene Savage ’58, champion of the state universities passed away on May 14, 2012. Read more>>
  • Karen House ’11G, is the interim vice president of finance and planning at Keene State College. Read more>>
  • Mark Bates ’75, will posthumously receive the 16th New England Construction Ethics Award. Read more>>
  • Joyce (Cooper) Larson ’11G, was named PSU’s Distinguished Professional, Administrative, Technical (PAT) Award. Read more>>
  • Kathleen Norris ’98CAGS, was named as PSU’s 2012 Distinguished Graduate Faculty. Read more>>
  • Joan Tambling ’83G, was granted honorary life membership in the College and University Professional Association for Human Resources. Read more>>
  • Allison Smedley ’12, is ready to join the New England Patriots cheerleader squad. Read more>>
